    <!-- PlaceHolder tag prevents inline radmenu.ClientID code below clashing with Utility.EnsureScriptManager(this); -->
    <script>

        $(document).ready(function () {
            giveAllMenuLinksAUniqueIdentifier();
            $(".rmLink").on("keydown", setSpacebarToOpenMenus);
        });

        function giveAllMenuLinksAUniqueIdentifier() {
            //Give all menu items a unique attribute value so that I can identify them when spacebar is clicked. Same 'menunumber' attribute is set in .aspx code on menu items.
            var index = 0;
            $(".telerik_main_menu li.rmItem a.rmLink").each(function (index) {
                $(this).attr("menunumber", index);
            });
        }

        function setSpacebarToOpenMenus(e) {
            //Open submenus on spacebar press. 
            var theKey = e.which;
            if (theKey == 32) { // 32 is keycode for spacebar. 
                var menuNumber = $(this).attr("menunumber");
                var menu = $find("ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl01_radmenu");
                var menuItem = menu.findItemByAttribute("menunumber", menuNumber);
                var submenuItems = menuItem.get_items();
                if (submenuItems.get_count() > 0) {
                    if (menuItem.get_isOpen() == false) {
                        menuItem.open();
                        e.preventDefault();
                    };
                };
            };
        };

        function ClickItem(menu, args) {
            //Event set in OnClientItemClicking="ClickItem";
            //When user clicks (presses Enter key) a menu item, if submenu is not open, then open it; otherwise navigate to the item's link. 
            var item = args.get_item();
            var submenuItems = item.get_items();
            if (submenuItems.get_count() > 0) {
                //If submenu is closed, then open it; otherwise click the menu item link. 
                if (item.get_isOpen() == false) {
                    args.set_cancel(true); //Cancel the default click action so that it doesn't trigger the menu item's navigation link.
                    item.open();
                }
                else {
                    if (typeof item.redirectToLink == 'undefined') {
                        item.redirectToLink = true;
                        item.click();
                    } else {
                        delete item.redirectToLink;
                    }
                }
            }
        }

    </script>

role="main"><h1>Quick Guide to Hiring</h1><div class="ptl_page"><div class="ptl_col_1"><div class="ptl_portlet_vertical"><div class="ptl_top_portlet" style="display:none;"></div><div id="ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl07_divContent"><div class="entry">
<ul style="margin-top:0in" type="disc">
    <li class="MsoNormal" style="color:#7F7F7F;margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;
    mso-list:l1 level1 lfo1"><span style="mso-bidi-font-weight:bold;
    mso-bidi-font-style:italic"><a href="#quick_guide">Quick Guide to Hiring for International Faculty, Staff, and Scholars</a></span></li>
    <li class="MsoNormal" style="color:#7F7F7F;margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;
    mso-list:l1 level1 lfo1"><span style="mso-bidi-font-weight:bold;
    mso-bidi-font-style:italic"><a href="#h-1b">H-1B Temporary Skilled Workers</a></span></li>
    <li class="MsoNormal" style="color:#7F7F7F;margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;
    mso-list:l1 level1 lfo1"><span style="mso-bidi-font-weight:bold;
    mso-bidi-font-style:italic"><a href="#j-1">J-1 Exchange Visitors</a></span></li>
    <li class="MsoNormal" style="color:#7F7F7F;margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;
    mso-list:l1 level1 lfo1"><span style="mso-bidi-font-weight:bold;
    mso-bidi-font-style:italic"><a href="#tn">TN - NAFTA Professional Worker</a></span></li>
    <li class="MsoNormal" style="color:#7F7F7F;margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;
    mso-list:l1 level1 lfo1"><span style="mso-bidi-font-weight:bold;
    mso-bidi-font-style:italic"><a href="#o-1">O-1 Workers of Extraordinary Ability</a></span></li>
    <li class="MsoNormal" style="color:#7F7F7F;margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;
    mso-list:l1 level1 lfo1"><span style="mso-bidi-font-weight:bold;
    mso-bidi-font-style:italic"><a href="#Permanent_residence">Permanent Residence</a></span></li>
</ul>
<p class="MsoNormal" align="center" style="text-align:center"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal"><span style="font-size: 14pt; line-height: 115%; color: rgb(64, 190, 160);">&nbsp;</span></strong></p>
<strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal">
<h2 id="quick_guide">Quick Guide to Hiring for International Faculty, Staff, and Scholars</h2>
</strong>
<p>Most internationals coming to work, teach, perform research, or other  related duties at UIC will need to be sponsored through the Office of  International Services. The following is a list of common non-immigrant  classifications that allow an individual to work in the United States,  and which require OIS/UIC sponsorship.</p>
<p>There are other non-immigrant classifications that do not require UIC sponsorship, such as <a href="/cms/one.aspx?portalId=1581&amp;pageId=189726">B-1</a>, <a href="/cms/one.aspx?portalId=1581&amp;pageId=189727">WB</a>, and &ldquo;pending Permanent Residence not based on UIC employment,&rdquo; among others.</p>
<p>Keep in mind that the information below is only a basic guide for  UIC-sponsored internationals. OIS will make all final determinations regarding the most appropriate non-immigrant classification for each  individual case.</p>
<p class="MsoNormal" align="center" style="text-align:center"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal"><span style="font-size: 14pt; line-height: 115%; color: rgb(64, 190, 160);">&nbsp;</span></strong></p>
<strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal">
<h2 id="h-1b">H-1B Temporary Skilled Workers</h2>
</strong>
<p><strong><em>Basic Requirements:</em></strong> Bachelor&rsquo;s degree or  higher. The person must have the degree required by the position, and  there must be a direct relationship between the person&rsquo;s degree and  their work. H-1B status allows immigrant intent. Appropriate for both  non-tenure track and tenure track positions.</p>
<p><strong><em>Program limit:</em></strong> Up to 3 years at a time, for up to 6 years total. Extensions beyond six years may be possible under certain circumstances.</p>
<p><strong><em>Restrictions:</em></strong> Those individuals subject to  the Two-Year Home Residence Requirement, 212(e), as a result of previous  J-1 status do not qualify unless 1) the J-1 visitor completes the home  residence requirement or 2) obtains a recommendation from Department of  State for a waiver. A minimum salary is required, however, the minimum  acceptable salary will not be known until after the sponsorship process  has been initiated by OIS.</p>
<p><strong><em>Agencies involved:</em></strong> U.S. Department of Labor (DOL) and a U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Service (USCIS)</p>
<p><strong><em>Processing times:</em></strong></p>
<ul>
    <li><em>New employment</em>: 4-6 months normally, or 3-4 months if Premium Processing is used to expedite service.
    <ul>
        <li>First time employment at UIC in H-1B status</li>
        <li>Does not currently hold H-1B status elsewhere (a.k.a. &ldquo;Portability&rdquo;)</li>
    </ul>
    </li>
    <li><em>New employment, Portability</em>: 2-3 months
    <ul>
        <li>International currently holds H-1B status with another employer</li>
        <li>Premium Processing not necessary unless international travel is planned shortly</li>
    </ul>
    </li>
    <li><em>Extension:</em> 2-3 months
    <ul>
        <li>Extension of current UIC employment without change in position</li>
    </ul>
    </li>
    <li><em>Amendment</em>: 2-3 months
    <ul>
        <li>Change in UIC H-1B&rsquo;s current employment, i.e. a promotion</li>
        <li>Discuss case with OIS in advance</li>
    </ul>
    </li>
</ul>
<p><strong><em>Fees</em>:</strong> Appropriate departmental fees will apply.</p>
<p class="MsoNormal" align="center" style="text-align:center"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal"><span style="font-size: 14pt; line-height: 115%; color: rgb(64, 190, 160);">&nbsp;</span></strong></p>
<strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal">
<h2 id="j-1">J-1 Exchange Visitors</h2>
</strong>
<p><strong><em>Basic Requirements</em>:</strong> May be used for short  to medium-term visitors. Funding may come from various sources: UIC,  personal funds, or outside sources, such as one&rsquo;s home government. The J  program has multiple &ldquo;categories;&rdquo; OIS will determine the appropriate  category for each case based upon information provided on the DS-2019  Request Form. All J-1 categories must demonstrate sufficient English  proficiency. Other requirements depend upon the category:</p>
<ul>
    <li><em>Short-Term Scholar, Research Scholar/Professor, and Specialist:</em> Must have at least some graduate education, plus demonstrated expertise in his or her field.</li>
    <li><em>Student Intern:</em> Must be currently enrolled and pursuing a  degree at a postsecondary academic institution outside the U.S. The UIC  internship must fulfill the educational objectives for his or her  foreign degree program.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong><em>Program limit</em>:</strong> Limits range from 6 months to 5 years depending on the J-1 category.</p>
<p><strong><em>Restrictions</em>:</strong> J-1 status does not allow  immigrant-intent and is therefore not appropriate for tenure-track  positions. The &ldquo;12-month bar&rdquo; prohibits a person from becoming a  Research Scholar/Professor for 12 months if he or she was previously in J  status for more than 6 of the previous 12 months in a category other  than Short Term Scholar. The &ldquo;24-month bar&rdquo; prohibits a person from  becoming a Research Scholar/Professor for 24 months, if they were  previously a Research Scholar/Professor.</p>
<p><strong><em>Agencies involved</em>:</strong> OIS is authorized by the  U.S. Department of State to issue a Form DS-2019, which the Exchange  Visitor would use to apply for a visa at a U.S. Consulate or Embassy  abroad.</p>
<p><strong><em>Processing times</em>:</strong> Up to 10 business days. Please note, however, that applications should be submitted to OIS at  least 2-3 months prior to the intended start date.</p>
<p><strong><em>Fees</em>: </strong> Appropriate departmental fees will apply.</p>
<p class="MsoNormal" align="center" style="text-align:center"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal"><span style="font-size: 14pt; line-height: 115%; color: rgb(64, 190, 160);">&nbsp;</span></strong></p>
<strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal">
<h2 id="tn">TN - NAFTA Professional Worker</h2>
</strong>
<p><strong><em>Basic Requirements</em>:</strong> Must be a Canadian or  Mexican citizen who has been admitted on a temporary basis to engage in  business on a professional level under the North American Free Trade  Agreement (NAFTA).&nbsp;<strong>Not</strong> appropriate for tenure-track positions.</p>
<p><strong><em>Program limit</em>:</strong> Granted for up to one year at a time and is renewable annually for an indefinite period.</p>
<p><strong><em>Restrictions</em>:</strong> Must have Canadian or Mexican  citizenship. Their field must fall under the list of professions in  the NAFTA agreement, and they must have the appropriate degree listed. A  list of NAFTA Professions can be found in our <a href="/cms/one.aspx?portalId=1581&amp;pageId=189734">TN information</a>.</p>
<p><strong><em>Agencies involved</em>:</strong></p>
<ul>
    <li>USCIS &ndash; if OIS processes an extension or change of status within the U.S.</li>
    <li>USCBP (U.S. Customs and Border Protection) if they are entering the U.S. directly in this status.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong><em>Processing times</em>:</strong></p>
<ul>
    <li><em>By petition to USCIS</em>: (if in the country and/or travel is  not wanted), approximately 2-3 months  unless Premium Processing is used  to expedite service</li>
    <li><em>By border crossing with inspection</em>: immediate (See OIS <a href="/cms/one.aspx?portalId=1581&amp;pageId=189734">TN information</a>.)</li>
</ul>
<p><strong><em>Fees</em>:</strong></p>
<ul>
    <li>Appropriate departmental fees will apply</li>
    <li><em>At border</em>: check with border posts for current fees</li>
</ul>
<p class="MsoNormal" align="center" style="text-align:center"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal"><span style="font-size: 14pt; line-height: 115%; color: rgb(64, 190, 160);">&nbsp;</span></strong></p>
<strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal">
<h2 id="o-1">O-1 Workers of Extraordinary Ability</h2>
</strong>
<p><strong><em>Basic Requirements/Restrictions</em>:</strong> Individual must be in the top 5% of their field <strong>internationally</strong>,  and their preeminence must be documented. Often used for people who do  not qualify for H-1B status because of the two-year home residence  requirement due to prior J status. Change of status in the U.S. is not  possible if the person is subject to the Two-Year Home Residence  Requirement. For those individuals, travel and obtaining new entry visas  would be necessary for the O-1 and their dependents to obtain O status  after the USCIS approves the person for O-1 classification.</p>
<p><strong><em>Program limit</em>:</strong> Three years initially, after which it may be extended (indefinitely) in one year increments.</p>
<p><strong><em>Agencies involved</em>:</strong> Regional service center of USCIS</p>
<p><strong><em>Processing times</em>:</strong> Approximately 3-6 months, unless Premium Processing is used to expedite service.</p>
<p><strong><em>Fees</em>:</strong> Appropriate departmental fees will apply.</p>
<p class="MsoNormal" align="center" style="text-align:center"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal"><span style="font-size: 14pt; line-height: 115%; color: rgb(64, 190, 160);">&nbsp;</span></strong></p>
<strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal">
<h2 id="Permanent_residence">Permanent Residence</h2>
</strong>
<p>For employment-based Permanent Residence information see the <a href="/cms/one.aspx?portalId=1581&amp;pageId=189735">Permanent Residence section</a> of our website.</p>
</div></div>
